definition: Dadu River in Sichuan
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to cross/to pass through/to ferry
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]

sentences.english: In 1272, Dadu officially became the capital of the Yuan Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 在1272年，正式成爲大渡河首都元代。

sentences.english: Platform is surrounded by banks of the Dadu River from the date from the red granite thorough.
sentences.chinese: 臺基四周是用來自大渡河畔的棗紅色花崗石徹起。

sentences.english: The Red Army forced the Tadu River.
A stream was winding its way through the valley in into the Dadu river.
sentences.chinese: 一彎溪水蜿蜒流過山谷，匯合到大渡河去了。

sentences.english: Numerical simulation of Dadu River Bridge damage recognition was done.
sentences.chinese: 並數值模擬了石棉大渡河大橋進行損傷識別研究。

sentences.english: The road crosses the river there.
sentences.chinese: 這時紅軍強渡了大渡河。
